description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to empower municipal councils become more effective & autonomous bodies, better able to withstand the executive’s influence, by properly fulfilling their assigned roles of legislation, oversight and representation.

activity-description.narrative: Selected municipality for support during the first year

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Selected municipality for support during the first year

description.narrative:
Output indicator
1. The value of PEFA index on orderliness and participation of the municipal councils in the annual budget process increased 2. Annual increase of the Basic Budget of the participating municipalities 3. The value of PEFA index on public access to key fiscal information increased 4. The score of the councilors’ and citizens’ satisfaction with participation in the budgeting process 5. Municipal councils’ role in the local power triangle with Mayors and municipal administration reinforced thanks to increased knowledge and confidence on the part of councilors 6. The value of PEFA index on budget implementation (aggregate expenditure out-turn compared to original approved budget) increased. 7. The value of PEFA index on effectiveness in collection of tax payments increased. 8. The value of PEFA index on effectiveness of internal audit increased 9. The score on citizen satisfaction with the transparency and accountability of the municipal bodies increased. 10. Number of municipal councils that demonstrate capacity for adequate gender budgeting
Activity indicators
1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports 1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations 1.3 Percentage of municipalities that regularly publish financial information on the municipal web-sites: - Current Year Budget - Annual Report 1.4 Number of municipal councils that regularly discuss in-year financial reports 1.5 Percentage of the municipalities that regularly publish on-line information on: - Municipal Council Session Agenda - Municipal Council Session Minutes - Contact details of the councillors 1.6 Percentage of the municipalities that offer problem reporting on-line tools 1.7 Number of prepared and adequately budgeted annual Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men 1.8 Number of activities proposed by councillors for nurturing and fostering inter-communit

comment.narrative:
Output baseline:
1. 3 B+, 3 B (2015) 2. MKD 12 bil. /CHF 213mil (2014) 3. 6 B (2015) 4. N=25: 7,25 (councillors) /5,49 (citizens) (2015) 5. The councils’ role in finance is deemed marginal due to lack of knowledge N=6, 3 municipal councils 6. 1 A; 2 C; 3 D (2015) 7. 6 D+ (2015) 8. 1 B+; 2 C+s; 2 D+s; 1 D (2015) 9. transparency: 4,20; accountability: 4,50 (2016) 10. 3 action plans prepared and 2 action plans adequately budgeted
Activity baselines
1.1 N=3 (2015) 1.2 N=5 (2015) 1.3 59,26% (2015) 46,91% (2015)
1.4 N=2 (2015) 1.5 27,16 % (2015) 23,46% (2015) 22,22% (2015)
1.6 35,8% (2015) 1.7 N=3 (only 2 adequately budgeted) (2015) 1.8 N=2 (2015) 2.1 59 municipalities organized at least one Community Forum in the last 10 years (2015) 2.2 N=2 (2015) 2.3 6,61 (councillors) /5,85 (citizens) (2015) 2.4 6,29 (2015) 2.5 100 projects selected by the citizens in all included municipalities have been implemented through the SDC’s Community Forums Programme in 59 (2015) 3.1 Only ZELS Committee od Councils exist (2015) 3.2 0 (2015) 3.3 0 (2015) 3.4 0 (2015)

1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports - N=3
1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations - N=5
1.3 Percentage of municipalities that regularly publish financial information on the municipal web-sites: - Current Year Budget - 59,26% - Annual Report - 46,91%
3.1 Number of networking events that enable improved horizontal communication and cooperation among council members from different municipalities: - thematic networking through events; - Only ZELS Committee of Councils exist - virtual peer groups organized through the e-learning platform; - cross-border cooperation with peers across the region
Cross-cutting

1.1 Entire set of preparation for the implementation of the Capacity Development Programme for the councilors has been completed. Briefs and manuals for modules M8-M11 were prepared. The Training of Trainers was delivered to 33 trainers and “Handbook for Effective Training of Trainers with Municipal Councilors” was prepared as a resource material for the delivery of the Capacity Development Programme. The ToT took place from 16-18 November 2017. It provided participants with practical skills for realization of training with councilors, based on the methodological and didactical approach of the adult education. It also provided participants with specific inputs to revise the training session plans in order to ensure delivery of efficient and effective training to the municipal councilors. Overall, 33 (15 of whom women) trainers are trained and skilled to deliver the Capacity Development Programme in accordance with the adult education methodological approach. Manuals and Briefs for all 11 modules of the Capacity Development Programme were developed, methodologically reviewed, designed and translated and are ready to be used in the Capacity Development Programme module delivery. Promotional video for each module has been prepared. All pre-conditions for CDP to start in 2018 are fully met.
1.2 E-learning platform is functional and during 2018 it will be populated with training materials to be available as interactive modules for on-line learning for the councilors.
1.3 The financial indicators from the Municipality of Veles started to be displayed on the e-dashboard and in 2018 this practice will start with the remaining 5 municipalities that will be directly involved in the project activities (Sveti Nikole, Strumica, Valandovo, Cair and Ohrid). This e-tool will contribute towards increased transparency and accountability of the municipalities. Banner linked to the e-dashboard to be placed within the municipal web-sites is designed. E-Dashboard is developed and translated into mobile applications supported by iOS and Apple operating mobile systems, and is available for download on Apple App Store and Google Play Store platforms.
3.1 Two thirds (55 of whom 8 women) of the Presidents of the Municipal councils have been introduced with the project activities and their response to participate in the activities was very positive. On the event organized for this purpose, “Empowering Municipal Councils: A Fresh Start for Local Democracy” (12-13 December 2017), important and relevant feedback was received from the councilors in terms of their expectation from this project. This will further shape the specific activities that are planned to start in 2018. The Facebook page of the project intended for enhancing the networking and cooperation among the councillors was presented to the newly elected presidents of the municipal councils at the event. As a result, the number of councillor approaching the page increased from 65 to 115.
Final draft of the Comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government to inform the networking discussions was prepared. The Review gives detailed overview of six countries’ (Macedonia, Slovenia, Serbia, Denmark, Lithuania, Albania) legislative and institutional frameworks regarding municipal councils, identifies specific practices for improvement of the work and credibility of the councils, and proposes supporting measures to confront with the existing system in the country. The Review was developed based on a desk research od relevant documentation as well as with direct interviews with relevant authorities within the involved countries. Additionally, the consultant realized in-country mission thus enabling closer and on-site consultation with UNDP and relevant institutions and stakeholders including: ministries (Local Self-Government and Finance), the Association of Local Self-Government Units (ZELS), Association of Finance Officers (AFO), President of Council of the municipality of Kisela Voda and President of the Committee of Councils within ZELS and representatives from Gradsko Municipality. In the frameworks of the mission, a Policy Workshop took place on 14 July 2017 where the consultant presented the findings and the recommendations of the comparative review. 25 participants (of whom 5 women) presidents of municipal councils, representatives from ZELS and AFO and experts attended the workshop. The inputs and feedback provided by UNDP and obtained through the individual meetings and the Policy Workshops were discussed with the consultant and consequently were incorporated in the final version of the Review. The findings from the Comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government will be used in the networking events for the councilors that will take place in 2018. Additionally, the document gives inputs for specific activities and initiatives that could be undertaken at local level regarding the promotion of the gender equality, interethnic relation and social inclusion as these were the indicators separately elaborated in the Review.
The Code of Ethics for Local Government Officials was analysed through: desk review on utilization of the existing Code in terms of its relevance and up-to-datedness with the latest ethical standards for locally elected and appointed officials, a comparative analysis with the Code of Ethics in three countries (Serbia, Denmark and Lithuania) and interviews and two focus groups with relevant stakeholders, representatives of the national and local government and non-government sector and media. The recommendation is for this document to have stronger promotion among the local government officials.
Manual on newly elected Local Government Officials was revised and published in cooperation and coordination with the Association of Local Self-Government Units (ZELS). The Manual is simple and concise guide for adequate and responsible execution of the tasks and obligations of the newly elected officials in the local government units. Through the seventeen chapters, the newly elected municipal councilors and mayors will get acquainted to the overall decentralization process in the country, the municipal structure, transferred responsibilities, as well as with the laws and legal provisions for their implementation. The Manual was published in Macedonian (1300) and Albanian language (350).
Annual and Semi-annual analytical reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures, and assessment of K-1 and K-2 quarterly reports were produced. In consultations with the Ministry of Finance, the report content has been agreed and is fully in compliance with the Ministry requests. This will enable the Ministry and the local self-government units to have more unified manner of both, municipalities submitting the financial data to the Ministry, and the processing of the submitted data by the Ministry.
Cross-cutting - Based on the developed Communication and Visibility Plan various visibility materials have been produces: promotional videos for the Capacity Development Programme modules; project fact sheet in three languages (Macedonian, Albanian and English), infographic banners also in three languages and web banner for the fiscal indicators. The project activities and expenditures have been regularly monitored and accordingly reported. The implementation of the project activities and the achieved results have been regularly shared on the project web site http://opstinskisoveti.mk/

1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports - N=3
1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations - N=5
1.3 Percentage of municipalities that regularly publish financial information on the municipal web-sites: - Current Year Budget - 59,26% - Annual Report - 46,91%
3.1 Number of networking events that enable improved horizontal communication and cooperation among council members from different municipalities: - thematic networking through events; - Only ZELS Committee of Councils exist - virtual peer groups organized through the e-learning platform; - cross-border cooperation with peers across the region
Cross-cutting

1.1 Entire set of preparation for the implementation of the Capacity Development Programme for the councilors has been completed. Briefs and manuals for modules M8-M11 were prepared. The Training of Trainers was delivered to 33 trainers and “Handbook for Effective Training of Trainers with Municipal Councilors” was prepared as a resource material for the delivery of the Capacity Development Programme. The ToT took place from 16-18 November 2017. It provided participants with practical skills for realization of training with councilors, based on the methodological and didactical approach of the adult education. It also provided participants with specific inputs to revise the training session plans in order to ensure delivery of efficient and effective training to the municipal councilors. Overall, 33 (15 of whom women) trainers are trained and skilled to deliver the Capacity Development Programme in accordance with the adult education methodological approach. Manuals and Briefs for all 11 modules of the Capacity Development Programme were developed, methodologically reviewed, designed and translated and are ready to be used in the Capacity Development Programme module delivery. Promotional video for each module has been prepared. All pre-conditions for CDP to start in 2018 are fully met.
1.2 E-learning platform is functional and during 2018 it will be populated with training materials to be available as interactive modules for on-line learning for the councilors.
1.3 The financial indicators from the Municipality of Veles started to be displayed on the e-dashboard and in 2018 this practice will start with the remaining 5 municipalities that will be directly involved in the project activities (Sveti Nikole, Strumica, Valandovo, Cair and Ohrid). E-Dashboard is developed and translated into mobile applications supported by iOS and Apple operating mobile systems, and is available for download on Apple App Store and Google Play Store platforms.
3.1 Two thirds (55 of whom 8 women) of the Presidents of the Municipal councils have been introduced with the project activities and their response to participate in the activities was very positive. On the event organized for this purpose, “Empowering Municipal Councils: A Fresh Start for Local Democracy” (12-13 December 2017), important and relevant feedback was received from the councilors in terms of their expectation from this project. This will further shape the specific activities that are planned to start in 2018. The Facebook page of the project intended for enhancing the networking and cooperation among the councillors was presented to the newly elected presidents of the municipal councils at the event. As a result, the number of councillor approaching the page increased from 65 to 115.
Final draft of the Comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government to inform the networking discussions was prepared. The Review gives detailed overview of six countries’ (Macedonia, Slovenia, Serbia, Denmark, Lithuania, Albania) legislative and institutional frameworks regarding municipal councils, identifies specific practices for improvement of the work and credibility of the councils, and proposes supporting measures to confront with the existing system in the country. The Review was developed based on a desk research od relevant documentation as well as with direct interviews with relevant authorities within the involved countries. In the frameworks of the mission, a Policy Workshop took place on 14 July 2017 where the consultant presented the findings and the recommendations of the comparative review. 25 participants (of whom 5 women) presidents of municipal councils, representatives from ZELS and AFO and experts attended the workshop. The inputs and feedback provided by UNDP and obtained through the individual meetings and the Policy Workshops were discussed with the consultant and consequently were incorporated in the final version of the Review. The findings from the Comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government will be used in the networking events for the councilors that will take place in 2018. Additionally, the document gives inputs for specific activities and initiatives that could be undertaken at local level regarding the promotion of the gender equality, interethnic relation and social inclusion as these were the indicators separately elaborated in the Review.
The Code of Ethics for Local Government Officials was analysed through: desk review on utilization of the existing Code in terms of its relevance and up-to-datedness with the latest ethical standards for locally elected and appointed officials, a comparative analysis with the Code of Ethics in three countries (Serbia, Denmark and Lithuania) and interviews and two focus groups with relevant stakeholders, representatives of the national and local government and non-government sector and media. The recommendation is for this document to have stronger promotion among the local government officials.
Manual on newly elected Local Government Officials was revised and published in cooperation and coordination with the Association of Local Self-Government Units (ZELS). The Manual is simple and concise guide for adequate and responsible execution of the tasks and obligations of the newly elected officials in the local government units. Through the seventeen chapters, the newly elected municipal councilors and mayors will get acquainted to the overall decentralization process in the country, the municipal structure, transferred responsibilities, as well as with the laws and legal provisions for their implementation. The Manual was published in Macedonian (1300) and Albanian language (350).
Annual and Semi-annual analytical reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures, and assessment of K-1 and K-2 quarterly reports were produced. In consultations with the Ministry of Finance, the report content has been agreed and is fully in compliance with the Ministry requests. This will enable the Ministry and the local self-government units to have more unified manner of both, municipalities submitting the financial data to the Ministry, and the processing of the submitted data by the Ministry.
Cross-cutting - Based on the developed Communication and Visibility Plan various visibility materials have been produces: promotional videos for the Capacity Development Programme modules; project fact sheet in three languages (Macedonian, Albanian and English), infographic banners also in three languages and web banner for the fiscal indicators. The project activities and expenditures have been regularly monitored and accordingly reported. The implementation of the project activities and the achieved results have been regularly shared on the project web site http://opstinskisoveti.mk/

1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports N=6 1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations N=6 1.7 Number of prepared and adequately budgeted annual Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men N=6 1.9 Number of innovative measures adopted by the beneficiary municipalities (at least one measure per municipality) N=6 2.1 The number of municipalities that organize community and/or budget forums at least twice per year N=6 2.5 Number of priority community projects that are implemented by the participating municipalities, creating broader positive societal impact with emphasis on social inclusion and addressing vulnerabilities N=18 projects 3.1 Number of networking events that enable improved horizontal communication and cooperation among council members from different municipalities: - thematic networking through events; - virtual peer groups organized through the e-learning platform; - cross-border cooperation with peers across the region 3.3 Overall proportion of councillors that are using developed mutually reinforcing info-exchange, cooperation and peer to peer learning system (e-Knowledge platform) N=85 3.4 Number of international cooperation of the municipal councils and exchange of experiences realized N=4
Cross-cutting

1.1 Capacity development trainings on 11 Modules were organized for municipal councils in 6 municipalities. The topics of the trainings and handbooks contained topics such as the role of municipal councilors in the local governance, budgeting, financial revenues and expenditures, financial audits, urban and special planning, inter-municipal collaboration or transversal topics such as equal opportunities for man and women, inter-ethnic relations. 21 trainings were delivered for 81 municipal councilors from six municipalities one third of whom are women. 1.2 E-learning platform is fully functional with all training materials (manuals, PP Presentations, working materials) uploaded in it. In addition, other relevant publications for the work of municipal councilors are uploaded as well. Trainings on Module 1 and 2 are also available for interested councilors as online knowledge tool. 1.7 All six municipalities including municipality of Chair which didn’t have such plan, have prepared Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men for the period 2018-2020. 1.9 All six municipalities have prepared project proposal for supply for equipment which will be used for life-streaming of council meetings as an innovative measure for transparency and accountability of the municipal councils. 2.1. Six pilot municipalities during 2018 have organized and conducted 24 sessions of the community forums for priority community projects. 2.5 In 2018 totally 39 project concepts were prepared and presented by different interested parties during the conducted community forums. Based on the previously presented criteria for selection with main focus on social inclusion of vulnerable and marginalized groups 18 project have been selected as priority community projects by the same working groups through democratic voting process. The whole decision-making process was led and conducted by representatives of the communities in the six municipalities. 3.1. Several networking events were organized to enable horizontal networking and cooperation between the councilors. A monkey survey was conducted which made possible for all presidents of municipal councils to choose one or two from total seven thematic groups where they would like to participate based on their knowledge and preferences. All council presidents were gathered to a joint constitutive working meeting and defined their participation in the working groups. During 2018, thematic group on Finance and Budgeting organized its first meeting. This group is consisted of 23 council presidents. During the national conference organized in cooperation with NDI – Women in Politics on 27-29 April 2018 with the project support UNDP provided networking session between the women presidents of the municipal councils. In total 12 women presidents of the municipal councils discussed issues related to women empowerment at the local level. Forums groups for all seven thematic groups have been created on the e- Knowledge platform which enables councilors to discuss different topics, give suggestions, share knowledge and experiences. 3.3. Over 470 councilors have access to the e-knowledge platform where they can follow the new knowledge’s, information contained in the project activities as well as communicate with their peers around the country. 3.4 13 municipal councilors had a chance to be exposed to regional practices and meet with their peers in Croatia and Slovenia during the 5 field visits organized in Zagreb, Bjelovar, Maribor, Ljubljana and Sisak. Another networking event is the visit to Kavadarci. Presidents of the councils of Chair, Tetovo, Kumanovo, Strumica, Sveti Nikole, Veles, Valandovo, and Karposh participated at the event.
Cross – cutting
Annual (2017) and Semi-annual (2018) Analytical reports on the municipal revenues and expenditures (Reports on Fiscal Decentralization) and Comparative Report on the municipal revenues and expenditures (Report on Fiscal Decentralization) for the period 2013-2017.

1.1 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of key budget documents and reports N=6 1.2 Number of municipal councils that demonstrate understanding of the external audit recommendations N=6 1.7 Number of prepared and adequately budgeted annual Action Plans for equal opportunities of women and men N=6 1.9 Number of innovative measures adopted by the beneficiary municipalities (at least one measure per municipality) N=6 2.1 The number of municipalities that organize community and/or budget forums at least twice per year N=6 2.5 Number of priority community projects that are implemented by the participating municipalities, creating broader positive societal impact with emphasis on social inclusion and addressing vulnerabilities N=18 projects 3.1 Number of networking events that enable improved horizontal communication and cooperation among council members from different municipalities: - thematic networking through events; - virtual peer groups organized through the e-learning platform; - cross-border cooperation with peers across the region 3.3 Overall proportion of councillors that are using developed mutually reinforcing info-exchange, cooperation and peer to peer learning system (e-Knowledge platform) N=85 3.4 Number of international cooperation of the municipal councils and exchange of experiences realized N=4

1. Preparation of 2016 Work Plan 2. Formalization of the partnership with the Association of the Finance Officers (AFO) and other project partners, such as the Association of Local Self-Government Units (ZELS) and UN Women. 3. Preparation and adoption of the updated Communication and Visibility Plan for the project. 4. Organization of the first Advisory Project Board meeting 5. Organization of the Project Launching Event (incl. promotion of the project web site) 6. Creation of a roster of 30 trainers 7. Preparation of the briefs and manuals for modules M8-M11 8. Population of the e-knowledge platform with training materials of the CDP (Modules 1 – 11) 9. Creation of a group of councillors to serve as an innovation-focused sounding board for the project 10. Installation of the e-dashboard on the municipal websites of the six directly selected municipalities and population with data on the budget execution 11. Creation of thematic groups consisting of 15-25 councillors each belonging to the Financing and Budget Committee, Equal Opportunities Committee, Inter-Community Relations Committee and other committees under the councils of the local self-government units (e.g. urban planning, social services). 12. Launching event of the Network of councillors 13. Preparation of a comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government to inform the networking discussions and organization of a policy workshop 14. Revival and revision of the Code of Ethics for Local Government Officials to promote a clearer and more visible role of the councillors in support of local government integrity efforts and organization of a policy workshop 15. Revision of the ZELS Manual on Municipal Councils 16. Design of opinion polls for councillors and analysis of responses and needs, through the e-knowledge platform. 17. Establishment of on-line focus groups of councillors. 18. Monitoring of networking activities and opinions and exploring opportunities to address needs. 19. Preparation of 2017 Work Plan and Budget

3rd Quarter 2016 2016 Work Plan drafted. Partnership with the Association of the Finance Officers (AFO) and other project partners, such as the Association of Local Self-Government Units (ZELS) and UN Women is close to be officially formalized (ToR/MoU drafted, respective technical and financial offers submitted by the AFO and the ZELS) Communication and Visibility Plan for the project prepared and endorsed by the SDC Firs Advisory Project Board meeting scheduled for 07 October, 2016. Project Launching Event and event for establishment of the councillor’s network scheduled for 12-14 October 2016 Project web site updated with content and ready for promotion. Narrative of the e-dashboard slightly revised and made even more user-friendly. Questionnaire for creation of thematic groups of councillors designed and communicated to the Presidents of municipal councils in advance to the event for establishment of the councilors network ToR for an International expert to work on “Preparation of a comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government” prepared and published. ToR for a national expert to work on “Revival and revision of the Code of Ethics for Local Government Officials to promote a clearer and more visible role of the councillors in support of local government integrity efforts and organization” prepared. Consultations with ZELS on the ToR are on-going.
4rd Quarter 2016 Signed contract with ZELS on 30.09.2016 with duration period of 01.10.2016 - 31.05.2020. Approved budget for the contract is 54.000 USD Signed contract with AFO on 07.10.2016 with duration period of 10.10.2016 - 31.05.2020. Approved budget for the contract is 285.000 USD First Advisory Project Board meeting held on 07 October, 2016 Partnership with UN Women is close to be officially formalized (MOU drafted and ready to be signed) Project Launching Event and event for establishment of the councillor’s network held in the period: 12-14 October 2016 First thematic groups consisting of 15-25 councillors created based on the Questionnaires Project website, e-dashboard and e-learning system promoted Ongoing evaluation procedure of the open call for International expert to work on “Preparation of a comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government” Roster of 30 trainers created Briefs and manuals for modules M8-M11 designed Opinion polls for councillors and analysis of responses and needs, through the e-knowledge platform designed Established on-line focus groups of councillors Continued monitoring of networking activities and opinions and exploring opportunities to address needs 2017 Work Plan and Budget prepared Created group of councillors to serve as an innovation-focused sounding board for the project

4rd Quarter 2016 Signed contract with ZELS on 30.09.2016 with duration period of 01.10.2016 - 31.05.2020. Approved budget for the contract is 54.000 USD Signed contract with AFO on 07.10.2016 with duration period of 10.10.2016 - 31.05.2020. Approved budget for the contract is 285.000 USD First Advisory Project Board meeting held on 07 October, 2016 Partnership with UN Women is close to be officially formalized (MOU drafted and ready to be signed) Project Launching Event and event for establishment of the councillor’s network held in the period: 12-14 October 2016 First thematic groups consisting of 15-25 councillors created based on the Questionnaires Project website, e-dashboard and e-learning system promoted Ongoing evaluation procedure of the open call for International expert to work on “Preparation of a comparative review of the role of the councils in the local self-government” Roster of 30 trainers created Briefs and manuals for modules M8-M11 designed Opinion polls for councillors and analysis of responses and needs, through the e-knowledge platform designed Established on-line focus groups of councillors Continued monitoring of networking activities and opinions and exploring opportunities to address needs 2017 Work Plan and Budget prepared Created group of councillors to serve as an innovation-focused sounding board for the project
